Detailed Description

2d graphics render class.

This class provides functionality for rendering 2d 2d graphics.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

~Render2D (   ) 
 

Render2D class destructor.

Unlock the screen video memory and frees entire memory occupied under the 2d graphics render.

Member Function Documentation

void Clear (  Int  type  ) 
 

Performs clearing of color or stencil backbuffer.

Only part of backbuffer defined by last call of SetViewport() will be cleaned. Call Clear() at the beginning of new frame drawing.

Parameters:
type see Render2D_Clear_xxx defines for more info.

void Draw (  SpriteTransform *  st_base,
SpriteTransform *  st,
Int  z_order = 0
) 
 

Apply drawing operations from base SpriteTransform class object to source SpriteTransform class object and send result to draw queue.

Parameters:
st_base pointer to base SpriteTransform class object that contain all base drawing operations.
st pointer to source SpriteTransform class object that contain Sprite2D and all drawing operations for it.
z_order define z order that will be add to result SpriteTransform class object base z order before sending to draw queue.

void Draw (  SpriteTransform *  st,
Int  z_order = 0
) 
 

Send SpriteTransform class object to draw queue.

Parameters:
st pointer to SpriteTransform class object that contain Sprite2D and all drawing operations for it.
z_order define z order that will be add to SpriteTransform class object base z order before sending to draw queue.

void DrawLine (  Short  x1,
Short  y1,
Short  x2,
Short  y2,
Int  color,
Int  z_order = 0
) 
 

Send line to draw queue.

Parameters:
x1 define x line first point position on global screen map.
y1 define y line first point position on global screen map.
x2 define x line second point position on global screen map.
y2 define y line second point position on global screen map.
color define line color value. See class Color.
z_order define line z order.

Short  y,
Int  color,
Int  z_order = 0
) 
 

Send point to draw queue.

Parameters:
x define x point position on global screen map.
y define y point position on global screen map.
color define point color value. See class Color.
z_order define point z order.

ObjRef<Image> FindImage (  const Char *  name_  ) 
 

Find specified image by ASCII name in image queue.

Parameters:
name_ pointer to ASCII name for specified image.
Returns:
Return pointer to Image class object if find complete successfully else NULL pointer.

void Flush (   ) 
 

Sort draw queue by z order and draw it.

After drawing clear draw queue. You can call Flush() several times per one frame as for example first draw all background and flush it to backbuffer and than draw foreground scene on it.

Byte GetAlpha (   ) 
 

Get alpha transparent value for all drawing operations.

Returns:
alpha value from 0 absolute transparent to 255 absolute opaque.

Int GetAndColorMask (   ) 
 

Get and color mask value for all drawing operations.

This color will be applied by AND binary logical operation to all drawing pixels.

Returns:
AND mask color value. See class Color.

Fixed GetColorGamma (   ) 
 

Get color gamma level.

Returns:
Return current color gamma level in Fixed point.

void GetColorReplaceTable (  Pixel *  color_rep  ) 
 

Get color replace table for all drawing operations.

Parameters:
color_rep pointer to 16 Pixels to store. See Pixel.

Short *  y
) 
 

Get origin for current viewport on global screen map.

x pointer to store x top left position of viewport on global screen map.
y pointer to store y top left position of viewport on global screen map.

Return specified width dimension of display.

Int GetStencilMode (   ) 
 

Get stencil mode for all drawing operations.

Returns:
Return 0 - if stencil mode off, 1 - if drawing and set stencil mask for all not transparent pixels mode on, 2 - if drawing only on pixels with stencil mask mode on.

const Rect& GetViewport (   )  const
 

Return current viewport Rect.

This rectangle determine viewport border on display.

Returns:
Return current viewport Rect.

Bool Init (  System *  system_,
Int  width,
Int  height,
Int  bpp,
Int  redbits,
Int  greenbits,
Int  bluebits
) 
 

Performs the complete initialization of Render2D.

This function must be called at the beginning of the initialization of program before any operations with 2d drawing.

Parameters:
system_ System class object pointer.
width The specified width dimension of display.
height The specified height dimension of display.
bpp The specified bit per pixel dimension of display.
redbits The specified red bits per pixel.
greenbits The specified green bits per pixel.
bluebits The specified blue bits per pixel.
See also:
System class for more info about System.
Returns:
Return True if Render2D init complete successfully else False.

Bool IsColorReplacementEnabled (   ) 
 

Check is color replace turn on for all drawing operations.

Returns:
Return True if color replace turn on else False.

ObjRef<Image> LoadImage (  const Char *  name_  ) 
 

Find specified image by ASCII name in image queue and if not found than load it from resource.

Parameters:
name_ pointer to ASCII name for specified image. Do not add file extension to this name.
Returns:
Return pointer to Image class object if find or load complete successfully else NULL pointer. Also increase found Image class object reference count by one.
See also:
Look Image class for more info about supported images.

x define x move for viewport on global screen map.
y define y move for viewport on global screen map.

Set and color mask value for all drawing operations.

This color will be applied by AND binary logical operation to all drawing pixels.

color_mask_ and mask color value. See class Color.

void SetStencilMode (  Int  mode  ) 
 

Set stencil mode for all drawing operations.

Parameters:
mode 0 - stencil mode off, 1 - draw and set stencil mask for all not transparent pixels, 2 - draw only on pixels with stencil mask.

void SetViewport (  const Rect &  viewport  ) 
 

Set current viewport rectangle.

Parameters:
viewport - rectangle defining viewport.
height define height dimension of viewport. SetViewport() can be called only one per Flush() call.

void SetViewport (  Int  x,
Int  y,
Int  width,
Int  height
) 
 

Set current viewport position and size.

Parameters:
x define x top left position of viewport on display.
y define y top left position of viewport on display.
width define width dimension of viewport.
height define height dimension of viewport. SetViewport() can be called only one per Flush() call.

void Show (   ) 
 

Copy backbuffer to video memory on display.

Only part of backbuffer defined by last call of SetViewport() will be copied.

void UpdateResources (   ) 
 

Releases all unreferenced resources.

Call this after releasing references to Image objects.
